'''Jordan Brauninger''' (born January 19, 1987 in [[Cincinnati, Ohio]], [[U.S.]]) is a retired competitive [[United States|American]] [[Figure skating|figure skater]] who now skates professionally. He is the [[World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2004 World Junior bronze medalist]].
==Biography== He began skating at age five. Before becoming a figure skater, he played [[ice hockey]] for three years. He then met [[Sergei Grinkov]] and changed to figure skating. He competed first as a [[pair skating|pair skater]] with Samantha Skavdahl. He landed his first triple [[toe loop jump|toe loop]] with the age of eleven and his first triple [[axel jump|axel]] when he was 16. He trains in [[Crescent Springs]], [[Kentucky]]. His coaches are Stephanie Miller and Ted Masdea. Brauninger represents the club Northern Kentucky SC. He lives in [[Ludlow]], Kentucky and is home schooled.
Brauninger retired from competitive skating during the 2005/2006 season. On June 27, 2007, [[Disney]] announced that Brauninger would play the role of [[Troy Bolton]] in [[High School Musical#Ice show|Disney's High School Musical: The Ice Tour]].<ref>[http://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCT=104&STORY=/www/story/06-27-2007/0004616414&EDATE= Disney's High School Musical: The Ice Tour Heats Up with Announcement of Principal Cast<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
